<ComponentPreview name="basic-elements-demo" />

<PackageInfo>

## Features

- Includes commonly used block elements: blockquote, headings, and horizontal rule.

</PackageInfo>

## Plugins

- `BlockquotePlugin` for `blockquote` element
- `HeadingPlugin` for `h1`, `h2`,... elements
- `HorizontalRulePlugin` for `hr` element

## Installation

```bash
npm install @udecode/plate-basic-elements
```

## Usage

```tsx
import { BasicElementsPlugin } from '@udecode/plate-basic-elements/react';

const plugins = [
  // ...otherPlugins,
  BasicElementsPlugin,
];
```

## Keyboard Shortcuts

<KeyTable>
  <KeyTableItem hotkey="Cmd + Opt + 1">Toggle heading 1 block.</KeyTableItem>
  <KeyTableItem hotkey="Cmd + Opt + 2">Toggle heading 2 block.</KeyTableItem>
  <KeyTableItem hotkey="Cmd + Opt + 3">Toggle heading 3 block.</KeyTableItem>
  <KeyTableItem hotkey="Cmd + Shift + .">
    Toggle the blockquote formatting for selected text.
  </KeyTableItem>
</KeyTable>

## Plugins

### `BasicElementsPlugin`

Plugin that includes all basic element plugins.

### `BlockquotePlugin`

Plugin for blockquote elements.

### `HeadingPlugin`

<API name="HeadingPlugin">
<APIOptions>
  <APIItem name="levels" type="number" optional>
    Specifies the heading levels supported, ranging from 1 to the specified levels.
  </APIItem>
</APIOptions>
</API>

### `HorizontalRulePlugin`

Plugin for inserting horizontal rules to separate content. Horizontal rules are void elements that render as `<hr>` tags by default.

Features:
- Insert horizontal lines to separate content or indicate topic shifts
- Type three dashes (`---`) at a new line start to transform into a horizontal rule (requires [AutoformatPlugin](/docs/autoformat) configuration)
- Void element that cannot contain text content
